name: Queen's Gambit Declined: Chigorin Defense
description: The Chigorin Defense - an unconventional defense developing the knight to c6.
strategy: Black develops the knight early, challenging White's central control. Less popular but leads to sharp, tactical games.

name: Queen's Gambit Declined: Chigorin Defense, Exchange Variation
pgn: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 Nc6 3. cxd5 Qxd5
description: White exchanges pawns immediately, bringing Black's queen to the center.
strategy: Early queen activity for Black, but the queen may become a target. Sharp tactical play often follows.

name: Queen's Gambit Declined: Chigorin Defense, Main Line
pgn: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 Nc6 3. Nf3 Bg4
description: The main theoretical line of the Chigorin Defense.
strategy: Black pins the knight and creates immediate pressure. Complex tactical positions often arise.

name: Queen's Gambit Declined: Chigorin Defense, Tartakower Gambit
pgn: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 Nc6 3. Nc3 e5
description: An aggressive gambit approach in the Chigorin Defense.
strategy: Black sacrifices central pawns for rapid piece development and attacking chances.

name: Queen's Gambit Declined: Albin Countergambit
description: The Albin Countergambit - Black immediately counterattacks in the center.
strategy: Black sacrifices a pawn to gain rapid development and attacking chances against White's king.

name: Queen's Gambit Accepted
pgn: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 dxc4
description: The Queen's Gambit Accepted - Black accepts the pawn sacrifice.
strategy: Black accepts the gambit pawn but should focus on quick development rather than holding the pawn. White gets rapid development and central control.

name: Queen's Gambit Accepted: Ericson Variation
pgn: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 dxc4 3. Nf3 b5
description: Black tries to hold the gambit pawn with b5.
strategy: An aggressive attempt to keep the extra pawn, but it weakens Black's queenside.

name: Queen's Gambit Accepted: Central Variation
pgn: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 dxc4 3. Nf3 Nf6 4. Qa4+
description: White uses a queen check to regain the gambit pawn quickly.
strategy: Direct approach to regain the pawn with tempo, leading to sharp play.

name: Queen's Gambit Accepted: Classical Defense
pgn: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 dxc4 3. Nf3 Nf6 4. e3 e6 5. Bxc4 c5
description: The most solid and popular line of the Queen's Gambit Accepted.
strategy: Black develops naturally and challenges the center. Both sides get good development with balanced chances.

name: Queen's Gambit Declined
description: The Queen's Gambit Declined - Black declines the pawn and supports the center.
strategy: Black maintains the central pawn and develops pieces naturally. More solid than accepting the gambit.

name: Queen's Gambit Declined: Been-Koomen Variation
pgn: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 c5
description: An active defense where Black immediately challenges the center.
strategy: Black seeks quick counterplay in the center rather than developing quietly.

name: Queen's Gambit Declined: Neo-Orthodox Variation
pgn: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 h6
description: A modern approach to the QGD with early h6 to clarify the bishop's intentions.
strategy: Black challenges the bishop early, often leading to tactical complications.

name: Queen's Gambit Declined: Lasker Defense
pgn: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 h6 7. Bh4 Ne4
description: Named after Emanuel Lasker, this active defense puts immediate pressure on White.
strategy: Black exchanges pieces to ease defensive burden and aims for equality through simplification.

name: Queen's Gambit Declined: Tartakower Variation
pgn: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 h6 7. Bh4 b6
description: Also known as the Makogonov-Bondarevsky System. One of the most popular QGD lines.
strategy: Black develops the queenside bishop via b7 and maintains flexibility in the center.

name: Queen's Gambit Declined: Orthodox Defense
pgn: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 Nbd7
description: The classical and most principled defense to the Queen's Gambit.
strategy: Black develops pieces naturally and maintains the pawn structure. The most tested and reliable QGD system.

pgn: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 Nbd7 7. Rc1 c6
